title: Ins, outs of golf explained in interactive new book
text:
Golf coach Paul Meyer shows how to be ‘The Complete Golfer’
TAMPA, Fla. (PRWEB) October 16, 2015
Paul Meyer has been playing golf for 40 years and teaching it for 17. In his new book, “ The Complete Golfer : Reaching Your Ultimate Golf Potential” (published by AuthorHouse), he shares what he knows and what he wants others to know about this sport. This exciting how-to guide offers an in-depth look at permanent improvement in golf in a no-nonsense, easy-to-read format.
“The Complete Golfer” discusses all areas of playing golf from the mental and emotional side to the strategy, practice and playing side. It encourages readers to look into what Meyer calls one’s “golf soul” and self-examine their golfing goals and aspirations. The book then helps readers build on those goals and make their aspirations a reality.
“The Complete Golfer” is unique in that it is presented in a workbook format. It is interactive and lets readers take note, write and answer questions related to them and golf. The author’s extensive experience as a coach and teacher is one of the things that make this book engaging and interactive.
“I want to share my knowledge and passion in a way that is easy for golfers from any level to digest and understand yet still challenge them,” Meyer says. “One of my greatest assets is in understanding how people learn. This has given me the knowledge in how to adapt, modify, and approach each individual golf student based on their learning style, interest, and ability.”
Useful for beginners and accomplished players, this book is a compelling guide into the world of golf and for becoming “The Complete Golfer.”
“The Complete Golfer”
By Paul Meyer
Softcover | 6 x 9in | 128 pages | ISBN 9781504927697
E-Book | 128 pages | ISBN 9781504927680
Available at Amazon and Barnes & Noble
About the Author
Paul Meyer has been a professional golf instructor for the past 16 years and a Wisconsin high school golf coach for 17 years. During his years of teaching, he developed a very successful program which included three state championships and two state runner-up finishes. On average he has given 200 lessons per year and a total of 3,000 lessons from beginners to PGA professionals. He also conducted numerous junior camps, clinics and specialty seminars over the course of his teaching career.
